headline: The Republican National Committee's Decision to Withdraw From Future Debates Is No Big Surprise
author: Murjani Rawls
sentences: Everybody remembers how off the rails the first 2020 Presidental debate wasstemming from the former President yelling, undercutting, and throwing out conspiracy theories while the current President tried to talk about policy.

For a political party whose main point of contention is that their voices are actively being stifled, they sure are ready to retreat from using them in a neutral environment that doesnt indulge their talking points.

Senate candidate Herschel Walker skipped the first major Republican debate with less than a month until early voting begins in the Georgia primariesmostly sticking to controlled appearances and rallies.
At least there he wont have to defend his misleading views on energy policy or claims that he graduated at the top of his class at the University of Georgia.
Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell stated at the beginning of the year that Senate Republicans have no plans to give an agenda before the 2022 midterms.
Its the same train of thought that frames Presidental elections as being riggeda strategy that doesnt require having to defend those claims as truth.
Republicans know that if they are put in a position to present policies that will better the American peoples lives, they will come up empty.
The constant rejection of order shouldnt be taken lightlymostly because Republicans dont want Americans as a whole to read the fine print.
For all the talk about staying in echo chambers, only one party requires their candidates to sign a pledge to remain inside their own.
So, they will label the institution as biased against them and seek to create a version where they dont have to answer for anything.
Remember when Sen. John Ossoff debated an empty chair when former Sen. David Purdue was absent before the runoff elections?
Im not surprised the RNC has withdrawn from its participation in the Commission on Presidential Debates, according to CNN.
When you dont have a plan to present and cant control the room, you will look horrible against somebody who is prepared.
Or the continuing movement to strip Black history and gender identity from every school district and bookshelf?
It would be best to do it because its right, but the Republican party isnt interested in tradition or morality.
Debate attendance is voluntary, just like Supreme Court Justice recusals from some instances.
Restricting voting rights and changing congressional maps to dilute minority voting power?
But if they had something substantial to offer, they wouldnt go into retreat.
Republicans have to have some self-awareness to know they looked terrible.
Of course, the state of Georgia is no stranger to political no-shows.
An ongoing crusade to take abortion rights away from women?
In reality, what record would they even defend?
